image.altText: Yellow police crime scene tape with a blurred suburban street in the background.

props.synopsis: Police say they believe an Adelaide man was murdered before his house was set on fire to deliberately destroy the evidence.

title.children: SA Police believe man found dead in house fire was murdered

image.altText: A woman holds an award in a room

props.synopsis: Professor Leah Bromfield, 46, was among those who led the charge for the first National Framework for Protecting Australia's Children in 2007.

title.children: Child protection advocate awarded Australian of the Year for SA

image.altText: A pub and a general store overlooking a river with a pine tree in the middle

props.synopsis: Anger at the closure of popular tourist attractions in the border town of Nelson over the past three years sparks a movement hoping to cut through bureaucracy and create a new plan for the future.

title.children: After years of hard knocks, residents rage against red tape 'quagmire' in bid to save tiny town

image.altText: Wide open windows overlook green trees, with an angular house constructed of red brick and rich wood

props.synopsis: Australia's best-designed new buildings have been lavished with praise at the national architecture awards, including a beach home "rich in detail and delight" as well as the embassy building in Washington.

title.children: Melbourne home, beach house and embassy in US among big winners at national architecture awards

image.altText: A man in a suit and glasses carrying a bag walks along a sidewalk next to a sandstone-colored building

props.synopsis: Richard Boyle first became an internal whistleblower in 2017, when he became concerned about operations in the tax office.

title.children: Tax office whistleblower Richard Boyle set to stand trial

image.altText: A man with white beard wearing a hat and sunglasses

props.synopsis: A man who groomed and sexually abused a nine-year-old Filipino girl after befriending her mother has been sentenced to 15 years' imprisonment.

title.children: Paedophile handed 15-year sentence for persistent sexual abuse of child overseas

image.altText: Close of up young woman with brown curly hair, gazes seriously, wears black leather jacket, white blouse, necklace.

props.synopsis: The Adelaide singer and songwriter won no less than four awards including best new artist, best solo artist, and the most popular pop artist.

title.children: Solo artist Aleksiah wins big at the SA Music Awards as Guy Sebastian is inducted into hall of fame

image.altText: Man speaking with two other men.

props.synopsis: The NSW premier admits the state government needs to do better for regional communities during a meeting with hundreds of residents at Broken Hill.

title.children: 'Just not good enough': Minns tells Broken Hill work to be done to ensure regional NSW not left behind

image.altText: Tobacco wars presser

props.synopsis: South Australia has had 19 arson attacks believed to be related to the sale of illegal tobacco, while more than $5 million worth of illicit products have been seized.

title.children: Police crack down as tobacco wars spread into South Australia

image.altText: face mask being worn in office generic

props.synopsis: A COVID-era surge in the death rate has shaved months off the life expectancy of Australians, who remain among the longest-lived people in the world.

title.children: A spike in COVID deaths has driven a decline in Australian life expectancy for the second year running

image.altText: A man smiles at the camera while holding a sign that says Latinos for Trump

props.synopsis: Democrats were once able to count on their popularity among multiple racial demographics in the US, but some in these groups — including Latinos and Black men — are turning their backs on the party. This is why.

title.children: 'I don't care that he's racist': These voters were once Democrats. Trump changed everything

image.altText: a woman claps while a man in a blue tie waves to the crowd

props.synopsis: The wife of JD Vance is the daughter of Indian immigrants who went to Yale law school and embodies many of the traits that would appear to rankle some of Trump's supporters.

title.children: 'Surely she can't be OK with this': Who is Usha Vance, the wife of America's next vice-president?

image.altText: A slightly blurry image shows a crowd of men on a city road ganging around several cars

props.synopsis: Dutch police say 62 people were in custody following clashes between Israeli soccer fans and pro-Palestinian protesters in Amsterdam.

title.children: Five injured and dozens arrested in Netherlands after Israeli football match clashes

image.altText: An example of a brochure

props.synopsis: Hundreds of thousands of Australians were allegedly misled by promotions offered by direct mail order catalogue Magnamail, some of whom were elderly or vulnerable, according to Australia's consumer watchdog.

title.children: ACCC sues over Magnamail's false 'prize' promotions, alleging it misled the 'vulnerable and elderly'

image.altText: A nurse prepares to give a needle to a baby

props.synopsis: Cases of whooping cough in Australia this year have surpassed 40,000 as vaccination rates decline.

title.children: Whooping cough cases break records, surpassing 40,000

image.altText: outside Newcastle courthouse.

props.synopsis: The woman who is giving evidence in the trial of her father has described her diagnosed dissociative identity disorder, formerly known as multiple personality disorder.

title.children: Woman tells child abuse trial of the 'living nightmare' of having 22 different identities feuding inside her brain

image.altText: dog with tongue sticking out wrapped in wet cloths.

props.synopsis: Large parts of Queensland, the Northern Territory and northern Western Australia remain under heatwave warnings today as hot conditions linger.

title.children: Experts urge people to keep indoors, stay hydrated as heatwave rolls across Australia

image.altText: Marcus Harris raises his bat after a half-century

props.synopsis: Marcus Harris appears to be the new leader in the great bat-off to find Usman Khawaja's batting partner at the top of Australia's Test line-up after a strong showing against India A.

title.children: Marcus Harris takes pole position in race for opening Test spot as tempers flare after controversial umpiring decision

image.altText: A hand placing a ballot in a voting box.

props.synopsis: Nearly a quarter of a million people in WA failed to vote in the 2023 referendum and now some are facing legal action after they did not pay a penalty or provide a valid reason for avoiding the polls.

title.children: West Australians ranked the highest in the country for failing to vote in the 2023 Voice referendum

image.altText: An eroded plaster body of a human sits on a table in front of a red and white fresco

props.synopsis: An international study has found assumptions on the sex and relationships of individuals found in the ruins of the ancient Roman city buried in a volcanic eruption were not based on scientific evidence.

title.children: DNA testing reveals Pompeii residents weren't who they were thought to be

image.altText: The apps listed on a phone screen.

props.synopsis: The communications minister confirms the biggest social media platforms won't be able to escape a ban on children and teenagers under 16, but the Coalition remains concerned the companies could develop new products targeting youths to evade the proposed laws.

title.children: Coalition asks for guarantee TikTok, Instagram and Snapchat won't 'sneak' out of ban using new products

image.altText: Lisa Govan in a tank top.

props.synopsis: The inquest into the suspected death of 28-year-old Lisa Govan in 1999 hears sensational evidence that she was seen with Gypsy Joker Billy Grierson on the morning she disappeared — a bikie notoriously killed by a sniper a year later.

title.children: Woman missing for 25 years in outback WA seen on back of slain bikie's Harley on morning she vanished, inquest told

image.altText: Des Hasler arrives at court

props.synopsis: The Manly Sea Eagles and former coach Des Hasler have avoided a bitter courtroom showdown, after agreeing to settle a messy contract dispute at the 11th hour.

title.children: Des Hasler settles legal stoush with Sea Eagles

image.altText: Liam Payne leads into microphone

props.synopsis: Three people have been charged in One Direction Singer Liam Payne's death

title.children: Three charged in relation to death of One Direction singer Liam Payne

image.altText: An image showing a large grey water pipe in a suburban area with a serious leak, water bursting.

props.synopsis: The ABC understands the 1.5-metre-wide pipe connects to Woronora Dam, which supplies drinking water for the Sutherland Shire and North Wollongong area.

title.children: Major water pipeline bursts, causing flooding of nearby homes in Sydney's south

image.altText: Steve Smith walks off as Mohammad Hasnain celebrates

props.synopsis: Pakistan's bowlers were dominant, led by Haris Rauf's five-wicket haul, as no Australian batter managed more than 35 in the second one day international in Adelaide.

title.children: ODI live: Pakistan needing 164 to win Adelaide Oval clash after Australia's nightmare day with the bat

image.altText: A bald man in a suit and green tie squints while he speaks.

props.synopsis: The 62-year-old, who took on the job after Jeannette Young's 15-year stint, will return to the Gold Coast University Hospital as an infectious disease physician.

title.children: 'Someone threatened to break my legs': Queensland's Chief Health Officer John Gerrard to step down from role

image.altText: Ronan Keating, Storm Keating, CEO Jamie Wilson and guest arrive at The Emeralds and Ivy Ball.

props.synopsis: Australian politicians sang the praises of a tech entrepreneur’s startup, but one collapsed company was marred with problems.

title.children: A tech entrepreneur who linked arms with politicians and celebrities has had a company wound up over unpaid bills

image.altText: A montage of three images of a three year old boy, with brown hair, smiling.

props.synopsis: Almost three years since NSW Police first went public with their theory that William Tyrrell's foster mother may have covered up his death, the evidence why is now being examined. But what was that evidence?

title.children: Police backed up their theory against William Tyrrell's foster mother. Little incriminating evidence was heard

image.altText: Kevin Rudd smiles and points as he walks through the marble foyer of parliament house.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump thinks Kevin Rudd is "a little bit nasty" and "not the brightest bulb". It is an open question whether Australia's ambassador to America will be able to deal with the returning Trump administration.

title.children: Should he stay or should he go? Questions surround Rudd as government confronts Trump 2.0

image.altText: A white statue in the centre of the picture, surrounded by sandstone and stained glass windows behind

props.synopsis: A Catholic diocese successfully appeals the compensation in a landmark civil case brought by a sexual abuse survivor, reducing its payout by more than $1 million.

title.children: Catholic diocese successfully appeals landmark $3.3m payout to victim survivor

image.altText: a man smiling sitting next to a woman wearing a wedding dress

props.synopsis: Jordan Fineanganofo repeatedly stabbed paramedic Steven Tougher without warning outside Campbelltown McDonald's while he was on a break with his shift partner in April last year.

title.children: 'Steven's killer got away with murder': Family of slain paramedic angry after court verdict

image.altText: Jacob Hersant, dressed in a white shirt and blue suit, photographed in dappled sunlight outdoors.

props.synopsis: A Victorian man who became the first person in the state to be convicted of performing a Nazi salute in public has been handed a one-month jail sentence, but will be released on bail after his lawyer indicated he would appeal.

title.children: White supremacist to appeal one-month jail sentence, conviction for Nazi salute

image.altText: A mosquiton on the skin of a human host

props.synopsis: Researchers say climate change has the potential to increase mosquito numbers and the transmissibility of mosquito-borne diseases. With some people more prone to mosquito bites than others, experts have reinforced the need to protect yourself from getting bitten.

title.children: Do you get bitten by mosquitoes more than other people? Here's why

image.altText: a huge crocodile in a small pond

props.synopsis: We've only got two US election questions this week, hope you paid attention to the rest of the news.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A giant crocodile, the Melbourne Cup, and a little bit of Trump
